description.en:
The course will include the following topics: 
1. Writing 
2. Publishing
3. Getting your work heard 
4. The changing nature of the university 
5. Academic Jobs (context)
6. Academic jobs (applying)
7. Academic CVs 
8. Research proposals 
9. Motivation letters 
10. Alt careers
description.et: Kursus tegeleb filosoofiadoktori karjääriga seotud vajaduste, võimaluste ja väljakutsetega. Käsitletakse järgmisi teemasid: filosoofiline kirjutamine ja publitseerimine, oma teadustöö nähtavaks tegemine, akadeemilise maailma muutlikkus, akadeemiline tööturg, kandideerimise ja teadusraha taotlemisega seotud tekstiformaadid, mitteakadeemilisele tööturule sisenemise võimalused.

objectives.en: The course provides Philosophy PhD students with knowledge of Philosophy as a discipline, of what they should be trying to achieve during their time as PhD students, and how to use their time during their PhD effectively to achieve these things.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda filosoofia eriala doktorantidele ülevaade filosoofiast kui teadusharust, aidata neil püstitada oma doktoriõpingute perioodiks vahe-eesmärke, ning anda näpunäiteid selleks, et õpingute aega efektiivselt kasutada.

learning_outcomes.en: 1) Become better placed to take control of their PhD studies and take themselves to the point they want to be at by the time they finish their PhDs.
learning_outcomes.et: 1) oskab oma õpingute käiku paremini hallata, et jõuda õppeaja lõpuks enda seatud eesmärkideni,

learning_outcomes.en: 2) Learn the ins-and-outs of writing and publishing in academic philosophy.
learning_outcomes.et: 2) tunneb akadeemilise filosoofia kirjutamis- ja avaldamistavasid,

learning_outcomes.en: 3) Learn how to write and up-date an academic CV.
learning_outcomes.et: 3) oskab koostada ja uuendada oma akadeemilist CV-d,

learning_outcomes.en: 4) Learn what's expected of them when applying for different kinds of academic jobs.
learning_outcomes.et: 4) teab, mida võidakse oodatakse akadeemilistele töökohtadele kandideerijalt,

learning_outcomes.en: 5) Learn how to prepare the road for them to enter non-academic jobs.
6) Gain an understanding of the economic context of the discipline and the university.
learning_outcomes.et: 6) mõistab oma eriala ja akadeemilise maailma majanduslikku tausta.

notes.et: Active participation in and preparation for the seminars is obligatory. If you sign up for this course, then you will be expected to actively participate in, and prepare for every seminar. If you cannot attend a seminar, then you must tell the course lecturer in advance and explain why. The course will function well only if students who sign up for it are active and support each other. Absences will be treated on a case by case basis. But if a student is absent without good reason, or absent so many times that it starts to thwart their ability to support their peers in the course and/or acquire the skills the course teaches, then the student risks failing the course.

independent_work.et: These will be provided on moodle.

grade_preconditions.et: To pass students will have to produce their own academic portfolio (academic CV, teaching statement, example cover letter, research proposal template, etc.) and demonstrate their understanding of the topics covered by the course: both through their active participation in the seminars, and by demonstrating that they have taken steps to structure their time as PhD students so as to plausibly generate a stronger academic profile (compared with their profile prior to taking the course).

resources.mandatory_materials: There will be weekly reading materials which need to be read and understood prior to each week's seminar. Sometimes these will be documents such as example academic CVs. Sometimes these will be articles on the topic of the seminar (e.g. the future of the university, or prestige bias within philosophy). These materials will be provided on moodle.
